column3: "This was an agreement between 65 nations not to use force to settle disputes. There was no clear way on how to enforce the pact. It was also negotiated outside of the League of Nations
column4: thereby undermining the League's authority and prestige as the guarantor of peace in the world."

column3: "Italy launched an invasion of Abyssinia. Abyssinia appealed to the League for help. The Abyssinian Crisis damaged global confidence in the League for good. The leak of the Hoare-Laval Pact damaged the reputation of the League to be able to act against aggressor countries. Furthermore
column4: the failure to impose sanctions on Italy decisively led to the Italian takeover of Abyssinia. As a result
column5: Hitler was convinced that the League would not be able to hinder Germany’s plan of expansion. "

column3: "fearful of driving Italy into the arms of Germany
column4: the foreign ministers of Britain and France
column6: secretly discussed the Hoare-Laval Pact with Mussolini in December 1935"

column4: Japan signed the Anti-Comintern Pact with Italy and Germany"

column3: Japan signed the pact which made it an ally of Germany and Italy.
"The formation of the Warsaw Pact in response to NATO and other American alliances
column4: solidified the world into two competing blocs led by the superpowers led to an escalation of tensions."

column3: "Gorbachev made a speech at the summit stating his intention to withdraw large numbers of Soviet troops
column4: tanks and aircraft from other communist states. In March 1989
column5: Gorbachev made clear to the Warsaw Pact leaders that the Soviet army would leave Eastern Europe and would no longer prop their countries up. In the months that followed
column6: there was a sudden and dramatic collapse of communism across Eastern Europe. For example
column8: Hungary declared itself a democratic republic rather than a communist republic. Furthermore
column10: the guards abandoned the Berlin Wall
column11: and jubilant crowds began to dismantle it."
